hedline.hl1: Reformers Appreciate Mr. Cuomo's Open Ear

block.p: While we appreciate your coverage of our efforts to forge a coalition out of the wide variety of reform groups in New York State, we thought your Dec. 11 news article on our meeting seriously missed the point.

While we appreciate your coverage of our efforts to forge a coalition out of the wide variety of reform groups in New York State, we thought your Dec. 11 news article on our meeting seriously missed the point.

You report on criticism of Gov. Mario M. Cuomo by two individual representatives at the meeting but fail to note the general feeling of appreciation for the Governor's decision to attend at all. Most of the 17 groups there, while critical of the Governor on some issues, were grateful for his attendance. Unlike others in our state government, he is the most willing to discuss reform.

You also neglect to mention the significant progress we made at the one-day session -- the first of its kind in this state -- toward developing a coalition of reform groups. We believe we have taken the first steps toward a broad-based serious effort to make our state government more responsive, accountable and efficient. All the groups in attendance agreed to continue to work together toward that end. TERRY ANDERSON Yonkers, Dec. 16, 1993 The writer, the former hostage, heads the Alliance for a N.Y. Renaissance.
